metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2752 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in SquirrelMail 1.4.21 and earlier allowsremote attackers to modify or add preference values via a \n (newline)character, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-4555.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squirrelmail - 2:1.4.22-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squirrelmail package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.4.22-1').
